snippet: Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany is under increasing pressure to change course on her refugee policy as more allies at home and abroad abandon her on the issue.
abstract: Political allies abandon German Chancellor Angela Merkel after her decision to admit more than one million asylum seekers in 2015; experts assert future of European Union depends on Merkel's management of political crises within Germany, continent's strongest economy and politcal bellwether.
lead_paragraph: Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany is under increasing pressure to change course on her refugee policy as more allies at home and abroad abandon her on the issue.
